The CN Tower is a 553.3 m–high concrete communications and observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario
Address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6
Height: 1,815′
Construction started: February 6, 1973
Opened: October 2, 1976
Hours:Thursday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Friday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Saturday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Sunday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Monday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Tuesday 8:30AM–10:30PM
						Wednesday 8:30AM–10:30PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 868–6937
Architect: John Andrews
Did you know: The CN Tower is struck by lightning approximately 75 times each year
 The Royal Ontario Museum is a museum of art, world culture and natural history in Toronto, Canada. It is one of the largest museums in North America, the largest in Canada
Address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6
Hours:Thursday 10AM–5:30PM
						Friday 10AM–5:30PM
						Saturday 10AM–5:30PM
						Sunday 10AM–5:30PM
						Monday 10AM–5:30PM
						Tuesday 10AM–5:30PM
						Wednesday 10AM–5:30PM
Province: Ontario
Architecture firm: Chapman and Oxley
Phone: (416) 586–8000
Architects: Daniel Libeskind, Frank Darling, John A. Pearson
Architectural styles: Romanesque Revival architecture, Byzantine Revival architecture
Artworks: Ukiyo–e print by Kitagawa Utamaro of a hunting party, Ukiyo-e print of Fukagawa, from "36 views of Mt. Fuji"
Did you know: The Royal Ontario Museum originally opened as 5 separate museums devoted to archaeology, geology, mineralogy, palaeontology and zoology, which amalgamated in 1955
 Casa Loma is a Gothic Revival style house and gardens in midtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada, that is now a museum and landmark. It was built as a residence for financier Sir Henry Mill Pellatt. Casa Loma was constructed from 1911 to 1914.
Address: 1 Austin Terrace, Toronto, ON M5R 1X8
Hours:Friday 9:30AM–5PM
						Saturday 9:30AM–5PM
						Sunday 9:30AM–5PM
						Monday 9:30AM–10PM
						Tuesday 9:30AM–10PM
						Wednesday 9:30AM–5PM
						Thursday 9:30AM–5PM
Cost: 3.5 million USD
Province:Ontario
Phone: (416) 923–1171
Owner:Municipal government of Toronto
Architect: E. J. Lennox
Did you know: The city seized Casa Loma in 1933 for $27,303 in back taxes.
 The Hockey Hall of Fame is located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Dedicated to the history of ice hockey, it is a museum and a hall of fame.
Address: 30 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5E 1X8
Hours:Friday 10AM–5PM
						Saturday 9:30AM–6PM
						Sunday 10:30AM–5PM
						Monday 10AM–5PM
						Tuesday 10AM–5PM
						Wednesday 10AM–5PM
						Thursday 10AM–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 360–7765
Architect: S. George Curry
Did you know: The 22 minute film plays at the top and half past the hour in the Hockey Hall of Fame TSN Theatre and is included in the price of admission.
 The Art Gallery of Ontario is an art museum in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Its collection includes more than 80,000 works spanning the first century to the present day.
Address: 317 Dundas St W, Toronto, ON M5T 1G4
Hours:Friday 10:30AM–9PM
						Saturday 10:30AM–5:30PM
						Sunday 10:30AM–5:30PM
						Monday Closed
						Tuesday 10:30AM–5PM
						Wednesday 10:30AM–9PM
						Thursday 10:30AM–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 979–6648
Completed: 2004
Date completed: 2008
Architect: Frank Gehry
 Ripley Aquarium of Canada is a public aquarium in Toronto, Ontario. The aquarium is one of three aquariums owned and operated by Ripley Entertainment. It is located in downtown Toronto, just southeast of the CN Tower.
Address: 288 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ON M5V 3L9
Opened: October 16, 2013
Floor space: 3 acres
Volume of largest tank: 100,300 ft³
Hours:Friday 9AM–11PM
						Saturday 9AM–11PM
						Sunday 9AM–11PM
						Monday 9AM–11PM
						Tuesday 9AM–11PM
						Wednesday 9AM–11PM
						Thursday 9AM–11PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (647) 351–3474
Number of animals: 16,000
Public transit access: Union Station, Unio
 The Distillery District is a commercial and residential district in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Located east of downtown, it contains numerous cafés, restaurants, and shops housed within heritage buildings of the former Gooderham and Worts Distillery.
Province: Ontario
City: Toronto
Designated as world heritage site: 1988
 Spacious market with 100+ vendors, bakers, butchers and artisans, with produce and antiques on weekends.
Address: 93 Front St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1C3
Hours: Open today · 8AM–7PM
Phone: (416) 392–7219
 The Toronto Islands are a chain of small islands in Lake Ontario, south of mainland Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Province: Ontario
 Huge array of shops, clothiers and restaurants in a soaring, historic mall with a glass ceiling.
Address: 220 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Hours: Open today · 10AM–9:30PM
Phone: (416) 598–8560
 Lake Ontario is one of the five Great Lakes of North America. It is surrounded on the north, west, and southwest by the Canadian province of Ontario, and on the south and east by the American state of …
Area: 18,960 km²
Surface elevation: 74 m
Max. depth: 802 ft (244 m)
Location: North America
Shore length1: 634 mi (1,020 km) plus 78 mi (126 km) for islands
Fish: Walleye, Chinook salmon, Coho salmon
 Ontario Science Centre is a science museum in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, near the Don Valley Parkway about 11 kilometres northeast of downtown on Don Mills Road just south of Eglinton Avenue East.
Address: 770 Don Mills Rd, Toronto, ON M3C 1T3
Hours: Open today · 10AM–4PM
Phone: (416) 696–1000
CEO: Maurice Bitran (Jun 16, 2014–)
Province: Ontario
Founded: September 26, 1969
Director: Maurice Bitran
Owner: Government of Ontario
Did you know: The Ontario Science Centre is easily accessible by public transport.
 Queen Street West describes both the western branch of Queen Street, a major east-west thoroughfare, and a series of neighbourhoods or commercial districts, situated west of Yonge Street in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Length: 5.6 km
East end: Yonge Street
West end: Roncesvalles Avenue; King Street
Existed: 1793 (as Lot St.); 1851 (renamed Queen St.) – present
Province: Ontario
 The Bata Shoe Museum is a footwear museum in downtown Toronto, Canada, located at Bloor St. and St George St. in the Bloor St. Culture Corridor. The museum collects, researches, preserves and exhibits, footwear from around the world. Wikipedia
Address: 327 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1W7
Hours: Open today · 10AM–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 979–7799
 High Park is a municipal park in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It spans 161 hectares, and is a mixed recreational and natural park, with sporting facilities, cultural facilities, educational facilities, gardens, playgrounds and a zoo.
Address: 1873 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6R 2Z3
Area: 398 acres
Hours: Open today · Open 24 hours
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 338–0338
Owner: Toronto
Did you know: The park has a designated off–leash area for dogs and several paths where dogs are allowed to run free.
 Chinatown is an ethnic enclave in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada, with a high concentration of ethnic Chinese residents and businesses extending along Dundas Street West and Spadina Avenue west of the centre of the city.
Province: Ontario
Hotels: Super 8 Downtown Toronto, Chinatown Inn Toronto, Chinatown Family House
 Yorkville is an affluent neighbourhood in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is roughly bounded by Bloor Street to the south, Davenport Road to the north, Yonge Street to the east and Avenue Road to the west, … WikipediaProvince: Ontario
Incorporated: 1853 (as village)
Annexed: 1883 (by City of Toronto)
Area code: Area codes 416, 647, and 437
Hotels: The Hazelton Hotel, Four Seasons Hotel Toronto\ Canada Wonderland is a 330–acre theme park located in Vaughan, Ontario, a suburb approximately 40 kilometres north of Downtown Toronto. Wikipedia
Address: 1 Canada Wonderland Drive, Vaughan, ON L6A 1S6
Opened: May 23, 1981
Area: 321 acres
Hours: Open today · 10AM–10PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (905) 832–7000
Owner: Cedar Fair Entertainment Company
Operating season: May–October
 Kensington Market is a distinctive multicultural neighbourhood in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The Market is an older neighbourhood and one of the city most well-known. In November 2006, it was designated a National Historic Site of Canada. Wikipedia
Province: Ontario
Designated as world heritage site: 2006
City: Toronto
Hotels: Chinatown Family House, Toronto downtown rooms Nassau st, Augusta Hotel, Global Village Kensington
 The Toronto Zoo is a zoo located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Founded by Hugh A. Crothers, an industrialist who became the first Chairman of the Metro Toronto Zoological Society in 1966, the zoo opened …
Address: 2000 Meadowvale Rd, Toronto, ON M1B 5K7
Opened: August 15, 1974
Area: 1.108 mi²
Hours: Open today · 9:30AM–4:30PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–5929
Number of species: 500
Products and Services: torontozoo.com
Notable animals: Eva (Bactrian camel), Goober (Bactrian camel), more
Exhibits: Tundra Trek, Australasia, Canadian Domain, Africa, Americas, Indo–Malaya, Eurasia
 Union Station 3.8(390)Historic transportation center Opened in 1927, this transportation hub offers bus, rail and bicycle services plus shops and eateries. 1800s village featuring period buildings, artifacts, costumed guides and educational programs.
Address: 1000 Murray Ross Pkwy, North York, ON M3J 2P3
Hours: Open today · 10AM–6PM
Phone: (416) 736–1733
Plan your visit
People typically spend up to 3 hours here
 The Centreville Amusement Park is a children amusement park located on Centre Island, part of the Toronto Islands, offshore of the city of Toronto in the Canadian province of Ontario. Wikipedia
Address: Toronto, Ontario M5J 2H3
Opened: 1967
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 203–0405
Operating season: May through September
 Allan Gardens is one of the oldest parks in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It has a conservatory, a playground and two fenced off–leash areas for dogs. It is operated by Toronto Parks who also run Centennial Park Conservatory.
Address: Allan Gardens Children Conservatory, 19 Horticultural Ave, Toronto, ON M5A 2P2
Hours:Friday 10AM–5PM
						Saturday 10AM–5PM
						Sunday 10AM–5PM
						Monday 10AM–5PM

						Wednesday 10AM–5PM
						Thursday 10AM–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–7288
 Nathan Phillips Square is an urban plaza in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It forms the forecourt to Toronto City Hall, or New City Hall, at the intersection of Queen Street West and Bay Street, and is named 
Address: 100 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M5H 2N2
Area: 12 acres
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 203–2600
Owner: Toronto
Design: Viljo Revell
Surface: Concrete
 Fort York is a historic site of military fortifications and related buildings on the west side of downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Address: 250 Fort York Blvd, Toronto, ON M5V 3K9
Hours:Friday 10AM–5PM
						Saturday 10AM–5PM
						Sunday 10AM–5PM

Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–6907
 The Toronto City Hall, or New City Hall, is the seat of the municipal government of Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and one of the city most distinctive landmarks.
Address: 100 Queen St W, Toronto, ON M5H 2N2
Hours:Friday 8:30AM–4:30PM
						Saturday Closed
						Sunday Closed
						Monday 8:30AM–4:30PM

						Thursday 8:30AM–4:30PM
Phone: (416) 392–2489
Province: Ontario
Architectural style: Modernism
Owner: Municipal government of Toronto
Construction started: November 7, 1961
Inaugurated: September 13, 1965
Architects: Viljo Revell, Bruce Kuwabara
 Besides exhibits, this ceramics museum offers classes, lectures and tours, plus a bistro and gift shop.
Address: 111 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C7
Hours:Friday 10AM–9PM
						Saturday 10AM–5PM

 Edwards Gardens is a botanical garden located on the southwest corner of Leslie Street and Lawrence Avenue East in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Address: 755 Lawrence Ave E, North York, ON M3C 1P2
Hours:Friday Open 24 hours
						Saturday Open 24 hours
						Sunday Open 24 hours
						Monday Open 24 hours
						Tuesday Open 24 hours
						Wednesday Open 24 hours
						Thursday Open 24 hours
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 397–1340
 Yonge–Dundas Square, or Dundas Square, is a public square situated at the southeast corner of the intersection of Yonge Street and Dundas Street East in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Address: 1 Dundas St E, Toronto, ON M5B 2R8
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 979–9960
Owner: Toronto
Design: Brown and Storey Architects
Surface: Granite
 Toronto Harbour or Toronto Bay is a bay on the north shore of Lake Ontario, in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is a natural harbour, protected from Lake Ontario waves by the Toronto Islands. 
 The Beaches is a neighbourhood in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is so named because of its four beaches situated on Lake Ontario. It is located east of downtown within the "Old" City of Toronto.
 The Textile Museum of Canada, located Toronto, Ontario, Canada, is a Canadian museum dedicated to the collection, exhibition, and documentation of textiles.
Address: 55 Centre Ave, Toronto, ON M5G 2H5
Hours:Friday 11AM–5PM
						Saturday 11AM–5PM
						Sunday 11AM–5PM
						Monday 11AM–5PM
						Tuesday 11AM–5PM
						Wednesday 11AM–8PM
						Thursday 11AM–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 599–5321
Founded: 1975
Public transit access: St. Patrick
 Spadina Museum: Historic House and Gardens, sometimes called Spadina House, is a historic manor on Spadina Road in Toronto, Canada that is now a museum operated by the City of Toronto Cultural Services.
Address: 285 Spadina Rd, Toronto, ON M5R 2V5
Hours:Friday 12–5PM
						Saturday 12–5PM
						Sunday 12–5PM
						Monday Closed
						Tuesday 12–5PM
						Wednesday 12–5PM
						Thursday 12–5PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–6910
Construction started: 1866
Architect: James Austin
 The Toronto waterfront is the lakeshore of Lake Ontario in the City of Toronto, Ontario in Canada. It spans 46 kilometres between the mouth of Etobicoke Creek in the west, and the Rouge River in the East.
Address: 20 Bay St, Toronto, ON M5J 2N8
Hours:Friday 8:30AM–5PM
						Saturday Closed
						Sunday Closed
						Monday 8:30AM–5PM
						Tuesday 8:30AM–5PM
						Wednesday 8:30AM–5PM
						Thursday 8:30AM–5PM
Phone: (416) 214–1344
Province: Ontario
 The red–brick Gooderham Building is a historic landmark of Toronto, Ontario, Canada located at 49 Wellington Street East.
Address: 49 Wellington St E, Toronto, ON M5E 1C9
Opened: 1892
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–1975
Architectural styles: Romanesque Revival architecture, French Gothic architecture
Architect: David Roberts, Jr
 Hanlan Point Beach is a public beach situated on Hanlan Point in the Toronto Islands near Toronto, Ontario on the shore of Lake Ontario.
Address: Lakeshore Ave, Toronto, ON M5J 2W2
Hours: Open today · Open 24 hours
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 392–8196
 Roy Thomson Hall is a concert hall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Located downtown in the city entertainment district, it is home to the Toronto Symphony Orchestra and Toronto Mendelssohn Choir.
Address: 60 Simcoe St, Toronto, ON M5J 2H5
Opened: 1982
Capacity: 2,630
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 872–4255
Function: Concert Hall
Architect: Arthur Erickson
 Sugar Beach is an urban beach park in Toronto, Canada, that opened in 2010. It is located across from Redpath Sugar Refinery in Toronto eastern East Bayfront.
Address: 11 Dockside Dr, Toronto, ON M5A 1B6
Opened: August 9, 2010
Area: 87,120 ft²
Hours:Friday 8AM–11PM
						Saturday 8AM–11PM
						Sunday 8AM–11PM
						Monday 8AM–11PM
						Tuesday 8AM–11PM
						Wednesday 8AM–11PM
						Thursday 8AM–11PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 338–4386
Architecture firm: Claude Cormier Architectes Paysagistes Inc
Architect: Claude Cormier
 The Don Valley Brick Works is a former quarry and industrial site located in the Don River valley in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Address: 550 Bayview Ave #300, Toronto, ON M4W 3X8
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 596–1495
Did you know: Evergreen Brick Works is Canada first large–scale community environmental centre.

 Harbourfront Centre is a key cultural organization on the waterfront of Toronto, Ontario, situated at 235 Queen Quay West.
Address: 235 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2G8
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 973–4000
Founded: January 1, 1991
CFO: Neil Kerr
Chief marketing officer: Mary Landreth
COO: Chris Hutchinson
 Attraction where participants in suits and harnesses circle the exposed top of the 356m–high CN Tower.
Address: 301 Front St W, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6
Hours:Friday 9AM–8PM
						Saturday 9AM–8PM
						Sunday 9AM–8PM
						Monday 9AM–8PM
						Tuesday 9AM–8PM
						Wednesday 9AM–8PM
						Thursday 9AM–8PM
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 601–3833
Did you know: EdgeWalk is Toronto tallest urban adventure and the world highest full circle hands–free walk.
 Chinguacousy Park is a large park in Brampton, Ontario Bramalea section. It is bounded by Queen Street East on the southeast, Bramalea Road on the northeast, and Central Park Drive on the north and west sides.
Address: 9050 Bramalea Rd, Brampton, ON L6S 6G7
Hours:Friday 10AM–8PM
						Saturday 10AM–8PM
						Sunday 10AM–8PM
						Monday 10AM–8PM
						Tuesday 10AM–8PM
						Wednesday 10AM–8PM
						Thursday 10AM–8PM
Phone: (905) 458–6555
Province: Ontario
 Centennial Park is a large regional park with many sports facilities, maintained by the Parks, Forestry and Recreation Division of the city of Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Address: 256 Centennial Park Rd, Etobicoke, ON M9C 5N3
Area: 525 acres
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 394–8750
 Woodbine Beach is the largest of the four beaches in the Beaches in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Located along Lake Shore Boulevard at the foot of Woodbine Avenue, it is next to Ashbridge Bay and Kew–Balmy Beach.
Address: 1675 Lake Shore Blvd E, Toronto, ON M4L 3W6
Province: Ontario
Phone: (416) 338–4386\ The Aga Khan Museum is a museum of Islamic art, Iranian art and Muslim culture in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The museum is an initiative of the Aga Khan Trust for Culture, an agency of the Aga Khan Development Network.
Address: 77 Wynford Dr, North York, ON M3C 1K1
Hours:Friday 10AM–8:30PM
						Saturday 10AM–8:30PM
						Sunday Closed

						Thursday 10AM–8:30PM

Phone: (416) 646–4677

 A sprawling green space with an old–fashioned amusement park, beaches, picnic areas and city views.

 Player One Amusement Group is a Canadian company which operates family entertainment centres in Canada. Player One is owned by parent company Cineplex Entertainment.
Located in: Square One Shopping Centre

Did you know: Playdium is the ultimate interactive, virtual and physical entertainment centre for energetic families
 Riverdale Farm is a 3–hectare municipally operated farm in the heart of Cabbagetown, an urban neighbourhood in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is maintained by Toronto Parks, Forestry and Recreation Division.
Address: 201 Winchester St, Toronto, ON M4X 1B8
Hours:Friday 9AM–5PM
